    privateÂ asyncÂ startup():Â Promise<void>Â {

    Â Â //Â SetÂ theÂ errorÂ handlerÂ earlyÂ enoughÂ soÂ thatÂ weÂ areÂ notÂ gettingÂ the
    Â Â //Â defaultÂ electronÂ errorÂ dialogÂ poppingÂ up
    Â Â setUnexpectedErrorHandler(errÂ =>Â console.error(err));

    Â Â //Â CreateÂ services

    Â Â tryÂ {

    Â Â Â tryÂ {

    Â Â Â }Â catchÂ (error)Â {

    Â Â Â Â this.handleStartupDataDirError(environmentMainService,Â productService,Â error);

    Â Â Â awaitÂ instantiationService.invokeFunction(asyncÂ accessorÂ =>Â {
    Â Â Â Â constÂ logServiceÂ =Â accessor.get(ILogService);
    Â Â Â Â constÂ lifecycleMainServiceÂ =Â accessor.get(ILifecycleMainService);
    Â Â Â Â constÂ fileServiceÂ =Â accessor.get(IFileService);
    Â Â Â Â constÂ loggerServiceÂ =Â accessor.get(ILoggerService);

    Â Â Â Â //Â CreateÂ theÂ mainÂ IPCÂ serverÂ byÂ tryingÂ toÂ beÂ theÂ server
    Â Â Â Â //Â IfÂ thisÂ throwsÂ anÂ errorÂ itÂ meansÂ weÂ areÂ notÂ theÂ first
    Â Â Â Â //Â instanceÂ ofÂ VSÂ CodeÂ runningÂ andÂ soÂ weÂ wouldÂ quit.
    Â Â Â Â constÂ mainProcessNodeIpcServerÂ =Â awaitÂ this.claimInstance(logService,Â environmentMainService,Â lifecycleMainService,Â instantiationService,Â productService,Â true);

    Â Â Â Â //Â WriteÂ aÂ lockfileÂ toÂ indicateÂ anÂ instanceÂ isÂ running
    Â Â Â Â //Â (https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/127861#issuecomment-877417451)
    Â Â Â Â FSPromises.writeFile(environmentMainService.mainLockfile,Â String(process.pid)).catch(errÂ =>Â {
    Â Â Â Â Â logService.warn(`app#startup():Â ErrorÂ writingÂ mainÂ lockfile:Â ${err.stack}`);
    Â Â Â Â });

    Â Â Â Â //Â DelayÂ creationÂ ofÂ spdlogÂ forÂ perfÂ reasonsÂ (https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/72906)
    Â Â Â Â bufferLogService.loggerÂ =Â loggerService.createLogger(URI.file(join(environmentMainService.logsPath,Â 'main.log')),Â {Â id:Â 'mainLog',Â name:Â localize('mainLog',Â "Main")Â });

    Â Â Â Â //Â Lifecycle
    Â Â Â Â once(lifecycleMainService.onWillShutdown)(evtÂ =>Â {
    Â Â Â Â Â fileService.dispose();
    Â Â Â Â Â configurationService.dispose();

    Â Â Â Â });

    Â Â Â Â returnÂ instantiationService.createInstance(CodeApplication,Â mainProcessNodeIpcServer,Â instanceEnvironment).startup();
    Â Â Â });
    Â Â }Â catchÂ (error)Â {

    Â Â }
    Â }

    Â Â //Â Product
    Â Â constÂ productServiceÂ =Â {Â _serviceBrand:Â undefined,Â ...productÂ };
    Â Â services.set(IProductService,Â productService);

    Â Â //Â Environment

    Â Â constÂ instanceEnvironmentÂ =Â this.patchEnvironment(environmentMainService);Â //Â PatchÂ `process.env`Â withÂ theÂ instance'sÂ environment

    Â }

    exportÂ functionÂ createDecorator<T>(serviceId:Â string):Â ServiceIdentifier<T>Â {

    Â ifÂ (_util.serviceIds.has(serviceId))Â {

    Â id.toStringÂ =Â ()Â =>Â serviceId;

    privateÂ _createAndCacheServiceInstance<T>(id:Â ServiceIdentifier<T>,Â desc:Â SyncDescriptor<T>,Â _trace:Â Trace):Â TÂ {

    Â Â typeÂ TripleÂ =Â {Â id:Â ServiceIdentifier<any>;Â desc:Â SyncDescriptor<any>;Â _trace:Â TraceÂ };
    Â Â constÂ graphÂ =Â newÂ Graph<Triple>(dataÂ =>Â data.id.toString());

    Â Â letÂ cycleCountÂ =Â 0;
    Â Â constÂ stackÂ =Â [{Â id,Â desc,Â _traceÂ }];
    Â Â whileÂ (stack.length)Â {
    Â Â Â constÂ itemÂ =Â stack.pop()!;
    Â Â Â graph.lookupOrInsertNode(item);

    Â Â Â //Â aÂ weakÂ butÂ workingÂ heuristicÂ forÂ cycleÂ checks
    Â Â Â ifÂ (cycleCount++Â >Â 1000)Â {
    Â Â Â Â throwÂ newÂ CyclicDependencyError(graph);
    Â Â Â }

    Â Â Â //Â checkÂ allÂ dependenciesÂ forÂ existenceÂ andÂ ifÂ theyÂ needÂ toÂ beÂ createdÂ first
    Â Â Â forÂ (constÂ dependencyÂ ofÂ _util.getServiceDependencies(item.desc.ctor))Â {

    Â Â Â Â constÂ instanceOrDescÂ =Â this._getServiceInstanceOrDescriptor(dependency.id);
    Â Â Â Â ifÂ (!instanceOrDesc)Â {
    Â Â Â Â Â this._throwIfStrict(`[createInstance]Â ${id}Â dependsÂ onÂ ${dependency.id}Â whichÂ isÂ NOTÂ registered.`,Â true);
    Â Â Â Â }

    Â Â Â Â //Â takeÂ noteÂ ofÂ allÂ serviceÂ dependencies
    Â Â Â Â this._globalGraph?.insertEdge(String(item.id),Â String(dependency.id));

    Â Â Â Â ifÂ (instanceOrDescÂ instanceofÂ SyncDescriptor)Â {
    Â Â Â Â Â constÂ dÂ =Â {Â id:Â dependency.id,Â desc:Â instanceOrDesc,Â _trace:Â item._trace.branch(dependency.id,Â true)Â };
    Â Â Â Â Â graph.insertEdge(item,Â d);
    Â Â Â Â Â stack.push(d);
    Â Â Â Â }
    Â Â Â }
    Â Â }

    Â Â whileÂ (true)Â {
    Â Â Â constÂ rootsÂ =Â graph.roots();

    Â Â Â //Â ifÂ thereÂ isÂ noÂ moreÂ rootsÂ butÂ still
    Â Â Â //Â nodesÂ inÂ theÂ graphÂ weÂ haveÂ aÂ cycle
    Â Â Â ifÂ (roots.lengthÂ ===Â 0)Â {
    Â Â Â Â ifÂ (!graph.isEmpty())Â {
    Â Â Â Â Â throwÂ newÂ CyclicDependencyError(graph);
    Â Â Â Â }
    Â Â Â Â break;
    Â Â Â }

    Â Â Â forÂ (constÂ {Â dataÂ }Â ofÂ roots)Â {
    Â Â Â Â //Â RepeatÂ theÂ checkÂ forÂ thisÂ stillÂ beingÂ aÂ serviceÂ syncÂ descriptor.Â That'sÂ because
    Â Â Â Â //Â instantiatingÂ aÂ dependencyÂ mightÂ haveÂ side-effectÂ andÂ recursivelyÂ triggerÂ instantiation
    Â Â Â Â //Â soÂ thatÂ someÂ dependenciesÂ areÂ nowÂ fullfilledÂ already.
    Â Â Â Â constÂ instanceOrDescÂ =Â this._getServiceInstanceOrDescriptor(data.id);
    Â Â Â Â ifÂ (instanceOrDescÂ instanceofÂ SyncDescriptor)Â {
    Â Â Â Â Â //Â createÂ instanceÂ andÂ overwriteÂ theÂ serviceÂ collections
    Â Â Â Â Â constÂ instanceÂ =Â this._createServiceInstanceWithOwner(data.id,Â data.desc.ctor,Â data.desc.staticArguments,Â data.desc.supportsDelayedInstantiation,Â data._trace);
    Â Â Â Â Â this._setServiceInstance(data.id,Â instance);
    Â Â Â Â }
    Â Â Â Â graph.removeNode(data);
    Â Â Â }
    Â Â }
    Â Â returnÂ <T>this._getServiceInstanceOrDescriptor(id);
    Â }

    asyncÂ startup():Â Promise<void>Â {
    Â Â this.logService.debug('StartingÂ VSÂ Code');
    Â Â this.logService.debug(`from:Â ${this.environmentMainService.appRoot}`);
    Â Â this.logService.debug('args:',Â this.environmentMainService.args);

    Â Â //Â MakeÂ sureÂ weÂ associateÂ theÂ programÂ withÂ theÂ appÂ userÂ modelÂ id
    Â Â //Â ThisÂ willÂ helpÂ WindowsÂ toÂ associateÂ theÂ runningÂ programÂ with

    Â Â constÂ win32AppUserModelIdÂ =Â this.productService.win32AppUserModelId;
    Â Â ifÂ (isWindowsÂ &&Â win32AppUserModelId)Â {
    Â Â Â app.setAppUserModelId(win32AppUserModelId);
    Â Â }

    Â Â //Â FixÂ nativeÂ tabsÂ onÂ macOSÂ 10.13
    Â Â //Â macOSÂ enablesÂ aÂ compatibilityÂ patchÂ forÂ anyÂ bundleÂ IDÂ beginningÂ with
    Â Â //Â "com.microsoft.",Â whichÂ breaksÂ nativeÂ tabsÂ forÂ VSÂ CodeÂ whenÂ usingÂ this
    Â Â //Â identifierÂ (fromÂ theÂ officialÂ build).
    Â Â //Â ExplicitlyÂ optÂ outÂ ofÂ theÂ patchÂ hereÂ beforeÂ creatingÂ anyÂ windows.
    Â Â //Â See:Â https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/35361#issuecomment-399794085
    Â Â tryÂ {
    Â Â Â ifÂ (isMacintoshÂ &&Â this.configurationService.getValue('window.nativeTabs')Â ===Â trueÂ &&Â !systemPreferences.getUserDefault('NSUseImprovedLayoutPass',Â 'boolean'))Â {

    Â Â Â }
    Â Â }Â catchÂ (error)Â {
    Â Â Â this.logService.error(error);
    Â Â }

    Â Â //Â MainÂ processÂ serverÂ (electronÂ IPCÂ based)
    Â Â constÂ mainProcessElectronServerÂ =Â newÂ ElectronIPCServer();
    Â Â this.lifecycleMainService.onWillShutdown(eÂ =>Â {
    Â Â Â ifÂ (e.reasonÂ ===Â ShutdownReason.KILL)Â {
    Â Â Â Â //Â WhenÂ weÂ goÂ downÂ abnormally,Â makeÂ sureÂ toÂ freeÂ up

    Â Â Â this._register(runWhenIdle(()Â =>Â this.lifecycleMainService.phaseÂ =Â LifecycleMainPhase.Eventually,Â 2500));
    Â Â },Â 2500));
    Â Â eventuallyPhaseScheduler.schedule();
    Â }

    privateÂ asyncÂ openFirstWindow(accessor:Â ServicesAccessor,Â initialProtocolUrls:Â IInitialProtocolUrlsÂ |Â undefined):Â Promise<ICodeWindow[]>Â {

    Â Â Â //Â windowÂ forÂ it.Â ThisÂ ensuresÂ weÂ areÂ notÂ restoring
    Â Â Â //Â allÂ windowsÂ ofÂ theÂ previousÂ session.
    Â Â Â //Â IfÂ thereÂ areÂ anyÂ moreÂ URLsÂ likeÂ these,Â theyÂ will
    Â Â Â //Â beÂ handledÂ fromÂ theÂ URLÂ listenersÂ installedÂ later.

    Â Â Â Â Â ifÂ (params.get('windowId')Â ===Â '_blank')Â {

    Â Â Â Â Â Â //Â ItÂ isÂ importantÂ hereÂ thatÂ weÂ removeÂ `windowId=_blank`Â from
    Â Â Â Â Â Â //Â thisÂ URLÂ becauseÂ hereÂ weÂ openÂ anÂ emptyÂ windowÂ forÂ it.

    Â Â Â Â Â Â Â context,
    Â Â Â Â Â Â Â cli:Â args,

    Â Â Â Â Â Â Â initialStartup:Â true
    Â Â Â Â Â Â Â //Â remoteAuthority:Â willÂ beÂ determinedÂ basedÂ onÂ openables
    Â Â Â Â Â Â });
    Â Â Â Â Â }
    Â Â Â Â }
    Â Â Â }
    Â Â }

    Â Â constÂ macOpenFiles:Â string[]Â =Â (<any>global).macOpenFiles;
    Â Â constÂ hasCliArgsÂ =Â args._.length;
    Â Â constÂ hasFolderURIsÂ =Â !!args['folder-uri'];
    Â Â constÂ hasFileURIsÂ =Â !!args['file-uri'];
    Â Â constÂ noRecentEntryÂ =Â args['skip-add-to-recently-opened']Â ===Â true;

    Â Â Â Â Â remoteAuthority,
    Â Â Â Â Â forceProfile,
    Â Â Â Â Â forceTempProfile
    Â Â Â Â });
    Â Â Â }

    Â Â Â Â });
    Â Â Â }
    Â Â }

    Â Â //Â default:Â readÂ pathsÂ fromÂ cli
    Â Â returnÂ windowsMainService.open({
    Â Â Â context,
    Â Â Â cli:Â args,

    Â Â Â initialStartup:Â true,
    Â Â Â remoteAuthority,
    Â Â Â forceProfile,
    Â Â Â forceTempProfile
    Â Â });
    Â }

    exportÂ classÂ IdleValue<T>Â {

    Â privateÂ readonlyÂ _executor:Â ()Â =>Â void;
    Â privateÂ readonlyÂ _handle:Â IDisposable;

    Â privateÂ _didRun:Â booleanÂ =Â false;
    Â privateÂ _value?:Â T;
    Â privateÂ _error:Â unknown;

    Â constructor(executor:Â ()Â =>Â T)Â {
    Â Â this._executorÂ =Â ()Â =>Â {
    Â Â Â tryÂ {
    Â Â Â Â this._valueÂ =Â executor();
    Â Â Â }Â catchÂ (err)Â {
    Â Â Â Â this._errorÂ =Â err;
    Â Â Â }Â finallyÂ {
    Â Â Â Â this._didRunÂ =Â true;
    Â Â Â }
    Â Â };
    Â Â this._handleÂ =Â runWhenIdle(()Â =>Â this._executor());
    Â }

    Â dispose():Â voidÂ {
    Â Â this._handle.dispose();
    Â }

    Â getÂ value():Â TÂ {
    Â Â ifÂ (!this._didRun)Â {
    Â Â Â this._handle.dispose();
    Â Â Â this._executor();
    Â Â }
    Â Â ifÂ (this._error)Â {
    Â Â Â throwÂ this._error;
    Â Â }
    Â Â returnÂ this._value!;
    Â }

    Â getÂ isInitialized():Â booleanÂ {
    Â Â returnÂ this._didRun;
    Â }
    }
